intro: Lupinus layneae, commonly known as Layne's lupine, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of blue to purple pea-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are compound, consisting of several small, oval-shaped leaflets. Lupinus layneae plays an important role in its ecosystem by fixing nitrogen in the soil, benefiting surrounding plant life.
